text: Look in your private application settings, under "domains", you must not have authorized access to this resource

```id: '24272129689',
    properties: {
      hs_createdate: '2022-08-04T08:53:26.087Z',

"/crm/v3/objects/notes" - Response does not contain hs_notes_body

any properties that are not returned by default can be included as a query parameter to your call
eg:  `?properties=hs_notes_body`

Hey, <@U01QVR44MEY>! Thank you for your response! So, I was successful in creating contacts upon a webhook trigger. However, the contacts don’t have the data that I tried to pass. Do you have any suggestions? Much appreciated!
Just double-checking here: can we create calculated properties with the API? The documentation doesn't say so, but I figure I would ask for confirmation.
I just find this, does it answer to your question ? <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/crm-setup/create-calculation-properties>

Thank you for the link, but it doesn't quite address my question.  I'm wondering if calculated properties can be created by using one of HubSpot's API offerings, like the CRM API or the Source Code API.

<@U03MNJADC3G> Those Properties are passed in the body of the request not as url parameters <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/contacts>
If you have the ability to add a body to that webhook then you could use that system, otherwise you'll need to a second system to pass the data to HubSpot (Zapier, Make, Serverless function)
tl;dr - yes you can. This section of our docs show how <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/properties#calculation-properties>
Thank you! I'm not sure how I missed that.

Has anyone in here created a private app for Rivery? We were integrated with them via the API key in the past. With the most recent API update announcement I created a private app for Rivery and tried to integrate via the access token but I am getting:

"*Error Message: * Received the following message: Testing connection to HubSpot failed: Received the following message: Received the following message: Response status: (401: Unauthorized): b’{“status”:“error”,“message”:“The API key provided is invalid".

 Do we now need to integrate with Revery via the credential integration or am I doing something wrong here?

Is there a way to get custom object-associated data not only does ID need all properties data like created date, title, path, etc?
